userreviews.userReview: Charity and Gabe had a one night stand eight years ago which was a big dissapointment. Charity still wants Gabe but he just wants to be friends. Gabe likes his sex rough and kinky and he feels that Charity is too nice to be able to accept his sexual desires. The more he pushes her away the more determined Charity becomes to have him for herself. When Gabe finally gives into her, the sex is hot and Charity loves every minute of it. Very sexy and passionate story.

Okay so I have been on a Lauren Dane kick lately and I think it's because I can always count on her books to give me a sweet smile. I really liked this one, I wish this novella and the one before it were a tad bit longer. I think both of them would do great full length. Oh and I would also would like Brian's story...sighI think Lauren Dane has great talent and I'm looking forward to reading more from her.4 stars

This is as good as the Chase Brother series by Lauren Dane, but doesn't have a suspense subplot and is much shorter. I LOVED the fact that there was so much about the supportive families of both characters and that they were strong and quite able to have happy lives without each other.I did think the conflict of the hero was idiotic pretty much after the first half of the story, as the heroine had already made it vocally clear that she was fine with what he wanted.I grinned at the fact that in this short romance the HERO runs off at the end because he's insecure of what he wants and the heroine comes after and sets him to right. Nice switch of clichés there.

Really enjoyed this book. Ms. Dane has a beautiful voice, and the dynamic between the hero and heroine really worked for me. I especially loved the natural and very real feel to the dialogue. The family scenes were described in a way that really worked for me--usually I get bored with that sort of information thrown into a book, but Ms. Dane wove it in there in a way that made me feel warm and fuzzy all over. I was very relieved when Gabriel came to his senses at the end of the story! I'll definitely be reading more of Ms. Dane's books this weekend.

What I really enjoy about Lauren Dane's writing is that she can flesh out supporting characters and a small town like more "chick lit" or classic contemporary romance authors (Higgins, Dahl, SE Philips), but still write excellent sex scenes between two (or more!) intelligent, encouraging, self-knowledgeable, and caring partners. She's just a delight to read and a great step up in quality for those who liked Fifty Shades and want more erotica.

This felt trite. And... Ugh. There are so many things about how the hero and heroine behaved and treated each other that I'm not okay with. This need to decide for each other and punish each other... :(This also needed some edits. This author's earlier works are too often full of comma splices. Semi colons and conjunctions are fabulous things. As are well appointed periods. Between the grammar, the surface level writing and the actual plot, I was supremely disappointed in this.

Another great story by Lauren Dane. I liked the fact that these two knew each other for a long time before the falling in love happened. Their chemistry was great and they were perfect for each other. I liked this story a lot :)

I dislike books where one person chases the other continuously, even when the second person keeps saying no. It's not cool to keep pursuing someone when they keep saying no- it's obsessive and stalkerish.

I just wasn't feeling this book. The writing style wasn't as good as other books I've read by her. I had to finish this story because I can't just leave it unread but it wasn't horrible, I just didn't care for it.

I Read this with in the day!!I freaking LOVED this story!!I am totally in love with the whole idea that they new each other for yrs and they are meant to be together!!And WOW it really opened my eyes up to BDSM!!!Cant wait to read more Lauren Dane!

Sweet Charity? More like naughty little Charity has NEEDS! It's always interesting to see a story unfold regarding a little girl who is not so little anymore. It's as if guys in stories can't deal with the girl they knew, growing up. I wonder why in real life there are no such issues?
Another great Lauren Dane book. I just can't seem to go wrong with her books.
I enjoyed the "chased" series more, but this was a good quick read.
I am glad that they finally got it together. I LOVED how she decided that she was not going to give up and kept after him to prove his quirks did not matter.
A magical combination of Christmas, sext hotness that smolders beyond imagination, and family...it should be wrapped up in a bow! Can't wait for Belle and Rafe's story...
Pretty good sex scenes, one featuring a bit of cane play. Niiice.
Enjoyable read, but I kept getting Deja vu. I think I've read this before. LOL.
Fun, sexy, quick read!
Read on Scribd. Liked this one quite a bit. I did think the ending was a little contrived, but still pretty good.
KOBO
I have one complaint Mrs. Dane, and that's that this was only a novella!
The only thing wrong with this book is that it is way too short! I like my Lauren Dane fixes in bigger increments. :)
read in this in Holiday Heat with Jaci Burton...

description: A bad boy is about to find out just how naughty a good girl can be.After eight long years of pretending a horrible one-night stand hadn t happened and wondering if it had been her fault, Charity Harris has finally coaxed handsome bad boy and lifelong friend, Gabriel Bettencourt, back into her bed. It s not just good, it s fanfreakingtastic! Trouble is, he s persisting with his story about not wanting a relationship and not being good enough for her even as their friendship blooms into something looking a lot like love. Gabriel has ached to make Charity his for years, and finally having her in his bed, not just enduring but enjoying his darker urges is more than he d ever imagined it could be. Despite what she says, he knows she deserves candlelight and roses, not candle wax and ropes. He ll enjoy her while he can and let go when she finds the right man. Charity knows Gabriel s game and she s not having any of it. A man can like it rough in bed and still be good and kind. He s exactly the kind of man she wants to marry and she will. She loves him and she knows he loves her and she s not taking no for an answer. So when he runs off to think just after Christmas, it s up to her to let him know that good girls can like it dark and rough and bad boys can be good men."
title:
Sweet Charity
      
          (Bettencourt Brothers #2)
